page.title: 11Medstead Abbey
page.content:
Medstead Abbey was built in 1908 from flint and brick. It was extended in 1956 and 1985. The abbey owns 80 acres of land, which is rented to local farmers. 4.5 acres of land are retained for the Abbey to use.
The Abbey is run by the Order of St. Benedict, and is a Church of England Order. The brothers are called black monks because they wear black habits. The habits are in two pieces - the tunic is called a scapula and there is also a hood.
The abbey makes communion wafers and incense. There are 11 brothers, and they look after 14 retired people, mostly sailors.
